Issues.Title: fix #13305  Baseline SnapLines do not appear in DesignSurface
Issues.Body:
fix #13305

## The cause of this issue
This issue is caused by [PR10279](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10279)

These are two of all changes make in [PR10279](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10279)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/155740a9-6e1e-4a7c-8581-9d813b1d149b)

`BehaviorService`, `DragAssistanceManager` use `SnapLines` to add some effects during design time.


`ControlDesigner` has a **_virtual_** property `SnapLines`, but most designers override the property, in other words,  _**most designers have customized `SnapLines`**_

### Code flow before [PR10279](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10279)

when `BehaviorService` or `DragAssistanceManager` accesses  `SnapLines` , customized `SnapLines` were returned.

### Code flow after [PR10279](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10279)

ControlDesigner.cs

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eee26426-1322-43f2-8100-7dddd8ccfd43)

when `BehaviorService` or `DragAssistanceManager` **_accesses  `SnapLinesInternal`_** , **_customized `SnapLines` were skipped._**

## Proposed changes

- 
- Use `SnapLines`
-

Issues.Title: Add _isReleasingDataSource to prevent unnecessary operations on CurrentCell when changing or releasing DataSource
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #13304

## Root cause

Regression introduced in PR #4637

When closing the dialog in edit mode, `DataSource` is set to null, and then `CurrentCell = null` is set. Then unnecessary method `EndEdit` of the `SetCurrentCellAddressCore` is called.

## Proposed changes

- Add `_isReleasingDataSource` in DataGridView and set it to null in property `DataSource` before setting `CurrentCell = null` to prevent the `EndEdit` method of the SetCurrentCellAddressCore from being called

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- When the DataGridView is in editing mode, its dialog box can be closed normally

## Regression? 

- Yes 

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
When a dialog with a DataGridView that has focus is closed, an `System.InvalidOperationException: Operation is not valid because it results in a reentrant call to the SetCurrentCellAddressCore function.` is thrown

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/58be58da-987e-4402-834a-1ec2bf036dc5

### After
The DataGridView dialog with focus can be closed successfully

![AfterFix](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b1b56b9-a69c-4435-8092-6facc6b6420c)

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 10.0.0-preview.4.25216.9

Issues.Title: DataGridView ButtonColumn cell text display issue when add new row
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10.0.100-preview.4.25214.31

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

**Current Behavior** 
* Add new row by checkbox
When the new row is on the border of the Datagridview, if we click checkbox to add new row, the added row ButtonColumn cell button text will not show or show incompletely. If we hover our mouse on the button or drag scrollbar upward and back again, the text will show up back.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/70053705-9262-41b4-943f-40ac5449c1cf

* Add new row by combobox
ButtonColumn having the same behaviour as above, but one additional issue is that the left border of the dropdown icon will disappear and will show back when click on other cell


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8867702-6f41-4260-8013-6546ad43cf75

**Expected Behavior**
The Button text and combobox dropdown icon left border should be display well when add a new row on the border of the Datagridview.

### Steps to reproduce

Download, unzip, and run this sample project to test the issue
[WinFormsApp4.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19791716/WinFormsApp4.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DataGridView ButtonColumn cell text display issue when add new row" (#13321)

Issues.Title: Custom WinForms ComboBox Flickers in Windows 11
Issues.Body:
I work on a Visual Studio extension.
I have been testing the extension on version 17.13 of Visual Studio with .NET Framework version 4.8

I have a custom WinForms ComboBox which I repaint by intercepting WM_PAINT in WndProc.
I first call base.WndProc.
Then I paint the background, border and dropdown button, and when the ComboBox is not editable, I also paint the text.

I also handle OnMouseEnter and OnMouseLeave, but I merely set a private '_isHovered' variable and then call the base function, and I do not call Invalidate()

I am also intercepting wm_ctlcoloredit and wm_ctlcolorstatic, but those do not seem related to this.

On Windows 10, the control works reasonably well and there is no flickering.
On Windows 11, when I hover over the control, it flickers a fair amount, especially when I hover back and forth near the dropdown button.

I have tried the following:
	- Intercept wm_erasebkgnd 
		○ This seems to help a little, but not much.
	- Set UserPaint, OptimizedDoubleBuffer, AllPaintingInWmPaint
		○ This did not seem to help, and I also seem unable/do not know how to render the text correctly for an editable ComboBox
	- Override CreateParams and set ws_ex_composited
		○ I did this in the custom ComboBox itself, not the form, because it is just the specific hovered control that is flickering
		○ This causes an unknown error

I have tried some other small changes too.

Do you have any advice/know what might be causing this issue?

Also, I see this issue: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/12739 
but it does not seem entirely relevant.

Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom WinForms ComboBox Flickers in Windows 11" (#13325)

Issues.Title: Add memory pressure management to AgileComPointer
Issues.Body:
Enhance the `AgileComPointer<TInterface>` class by introducing a `_memoryPressure` field and updating the constructor to accept a `memoryPressure` parameter. This allows for better memory management by informing the garbage collector about native memory usage.

In the `HtmlElement` class, define a `MemoryPressure` constant and update its constructor to pass this value to `AgileComPointer`, improving garbage collection efficiency when creating multiple `HtmlElement` instances.

Tried creating a cached version of the `AgileComPointer`, but that didn't help in this case as items in the linked repro were always new instances.

Fixes: #13195

Issues.Title: DataGridView no sort glyph at default settings
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net 6.0+

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Don't know.

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Don't know.

### Issue description

DataGridView no sort glyph when column header cell font is "微软雅黑"(Microsoft Yahei, msyh.ttc, the default font on chinese windows), and header border style is not None.

If change font to "宋体"(simsun.ttc), or set header border style to `None`,  sort glyph will show.

### Steps to reproduce

1. On chinese windows, create a Winform project, target framework is `.net8.0-windows`
2. Drag a `DataGridView` into `Form1`
3. Add few columns to dgv
4. Build and run, click column header, you'll see no sort glyph here
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView no sort glyph at default settings" (#13316)

Issues.Title: Update the min cmake version to enable native code compilation with cmake shipped in VS public preview .
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/13186
I chose min version that works with both the latest cmake (v4.0.1 requires min version 3.10)  and the version shipped in the public preview(v 3.30 requires min version 3.5).

This fixes error like this one
```
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:1 (cmake_minimum_required):
  Compatibility with CMake < 3.5 has been removed from CMake.

  Update the VERSION argument <min> value.  Or, use the <min>...<max> syntax
  to tell CMake that the project requires at least <min> but has been updated
  to work with policies introduced by <max> or earlier.

  Or, add -DCMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM=3.5 to try configuring anyway.
```
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13314)

Issues.Title: [Tracking] Investigate Clipboard Async support
Issues.Body: New Outlook and other chromium-based applications require asynchronous Clipboard support, which we currently do not have. We need to investigate the feasibility of adding this type of support.

Issues.Title: CustomToolStrip Not Selectable & Smart Tag not shown in .NET Core Designer
Issues.Body:
> When you need a Custom Control Designer in .NET for your control, the NETFX-way to implement that no longer works for .NET.
> 
> The reason is this:
> https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/custom-controls-for-winforms-out-of-process-designer/
> 
> The behavior you see, is by design.
> 
>  

 _Originally posted by @KlausLoeffelmann in [#13232](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/13232#issuecomment-2776660930)_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CustomToolStrip Not Selectable & Smart Tag not shown in .NET Core Designer" (#13308)
